summary:
Francesco Gibbi is a seasoned art collector with 15 year experience in fine art asset management. Understanding the investment opportunities offered by the art and luxury market as well as the need for more transparency for the investors, he founded " Lot-Art.com ", the art-finance platform which enables collectors to make informed investment decisions in Fine Art & Passion assets as an effective strategy of portfolio diversification. 

Master Degree in International Management and specialized in International Affairs, after covering  financial and management roles in International Organizations operating in the field of Impact Investment, Francesco is now sharing his expertise in art-related Alternative Investments.

He strongly believes that an optimal investment should bring more than the opportunity of capital conservation and a sound financial return: “ Art collecting is an investment and follows similar rules to the most common financial products but it is just more rewarding in terms of emotional feelings and less volatile in economic value if you well diversify your collection into contemporary, modern art and old masters. "

" A good investment starts with a cost-effective purchase. Leveraging on a sound expertise, auctions are the best source of good deals to anyone looking for alternative investment opportunities. "

More info on: 
https://www.liinks.co/lot.art

Specialties: Program & Project Management, Monitoring & Evaluation, Impact Finance,  Art Finance, Market Analysis, Strategic Planning, Investment Diversification, Institutional Relations, Negotiation, Public-Private Partnerships, Alternative Investment Advisory.

profile_positions.description:
LOT-ART.com | The Art Investment Platform 
Explore the Financial Side of Art  (Open to A round funding)
More info on our services at: https://www.liinks.co/lot.art

Understanding the specific investment opportunities offered by the art market as well as the need for more transparency and efficiency for the art investors, I launched "Lot-Art.com" with the aim to promote art investment as an effective portfolio diversification to financial markets, sharing my expertise as Alternative Investment Advisor in fine art and luxury collectibles.

Providing direct links to the most reputable auction houses & bidding platforms and offering advanced catalogue searching services, Lot-Art is the ultimate auctions' aggregator, marketplace and investment advisory, where collectors can invest in passion assets with the best quality / liquidity rate.

LOT-ART.com objective is to enhance the transparency of the art market by enabling collectors and investors to reach a comprehensive view of the global auction market from a single place. Lot-Art aims at stimulating art investment as an effective portfolio diversification opportunity to financial markets. 

NEW services are now available: 
- Art Investment Advisory to help you selecting the best performing deals in the global art market
- Buy-Now & Private Sales listing for art dealers and collectors.
- Automatic Best Deal identification on the Lot-Art platform powered by objective Market Analytics
- Asset Valuation and Liquidity assessment pre and post investment 
- Market Analytics for fine art and timepieces 

“ Lot-Art.com, with its advanced search engine and big data analytics, is the best tool for any investment decision-making in fine art and passion assets. ” 

For more information on Lot-Art services please visit: https://www.lot-art.com/about-lot-art

profile_positions.description:
At the CFC, an Intergovernmental Financial Institution focused on sustainable commodity development, I was responsible for the management of the full life cycle (origination, selection, due diligence, monitoring and evaluation) of development projects, liaising with Governments, the private sector and International Organizations for the efficient financing and effective implementation of  development interventions across Africa, Asia and Latin America.

CFC’s Loan & Grant-funded projects range from know-how and technology transfer to commodities’ value chain optimisation (horizontal and vertical integration), product diversification, market access, productivity and quality improvement of commodity sectors in developing Countries.  Their objective is to facilitate sustainable income generation along the value chain for producers, processors and traders (farmers‘ cooperatives and SMEs), while assuring the environmental sustainability of the operations.

During 11 years at CFC, I have matured an extensive experience in project Monitoring  & Evaluation assessing project performance yearly, as well as at mid-term and completion, in terms of efficiency of management, effectiveness of the activities and sustainability of outcomes. 

Results dissemination to partners and stakeholders was duly carried out with the production of detailed technical reports, informative videos and project brochures showcasing the overall project impact and relevant success stories collected on-field.

My activities included Networking & Liaising with senior Government counterparts, Negotiating with local and international authorities, Chairing international conferences, Presenting official statements to both public and private-sector stakeholders. In quality of liaison officer, I was responsible for the Coordination of CFC project activities with the FAO-UN, the International Olive Council, the International Cocoa Organization and the OPEC Fund for International Development.

profile_positions.description:
Programme Management Department (Headquarter): Review the structure of the Performance Based Allocation System, advising on possible changes of weightings and/or parameters in PBAS formula, for the optimal allocation of loans and grants to IFAD member Countries, Highly and Non-Highly Concessional Borrowers, in line with country needs, performance, the scope and nature of IFAD operations, institutional mandate and Lending Criteria; Prepare a series of simulations based on 2005-07 PBAS allocations, running sensitivity analysis of changing scenarios, with the final goal of maximising the impact on rural development and poverty reduction, ensuring that countries receive ex ante allocations resources in line with their demonstrated ability to use such resources effectively. 

The objective is to improve the effectiveness of development assistance by matching it to the level and extent of poverty and the assessed progress of borrowers in establishing a supportive policy and institutional framework for sustainable poverty reduction.
